chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent
Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Darquis M Lampkin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment and or schooling. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored accordingly. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. No contact with the victim. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Defendant is not eligible for expungement.

records.addlTxt: Per RCSO, DNA collected - 10-18-22 @10:17

10:39 AM Defendant Darquis M Lampkin in court.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Darquis M Lampkin.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - 22CF371 amended Ct 1- NO CONTEST. 
22CF293 Cts 1 & 3- NO CONTEST. 
22CF387 Ct 1- NO CONTEST. 
Factual basis found in complaint. 
BTC: 22CF371 Ct 1 GUILTY. 22CF293 Cts 1 & 3 GUILTY with Ct 2 being dismissed and read in. 22CF387 Ct 1 GUILTY with Ct 2 being dismissed and read in.  
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 
Sentence withheld. 
18 months probation.

Conditions of probation:
No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be  monitored accordingly. 
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment and or schooling.
Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. 
No contact with the victim.
Restitution ordered in the amount of $3579
Do not drive unless properly licensed. 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge

Defendant is not eligible for expungement.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim  A.D.M.S (person, property, residence or family). Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
